intro: Crepidium olivaceum, commonly known as the olive orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in racemes, often with a subtle fragrance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural collections.
